channel.title: Rfid on KCSEC
channel.description: Recent content in Rfid on KCSEC

item.title: Dangerous Things - Implant Series
item.description: Dangerous things do a range of implants, Too see for yourself check out their website and forum with the links bellow, https://dangerousthings.com/ https://forum.dangerousthings.com/ There are two different types of Implants currently the X Series and the Flex Series. XSeries The XSeries are the easier to implant and the chips are in cases in an small tube which can be injected into the skin. More information can be found here https://dangerousthings.

item.title: Dangerous Things - Different Implants
item.description: xEM RFID Tag [T5577 Emulator] https://dangerousthings.com/shop/xemi/ The xEM is a great starter tag for people just getting into RFID projects. It is compatible with many inexpensive OEM and commercial 125kHz readers and stand-alone access controllers. xBT Temp Sensing RFID Tag [BioTherm] https://dangerousthings.com/shop/xbti/ The xBT reports a simple ID number which works with any FDX-B tag reader, and can also transmit temperature sensor data to a compatible Bio-Thermo reader. xNT NFC Tag [NTAG216] https://dangerousthings.

item.title: My Implants
item.description: I’ve decided to order the following from Dangerious things to have implanted. xEM FlexNT VivoKey (When Released) Once the DesFire is out I will take a look at the potential applications for it that I could use. I’m waiting on parts and the implants which should take 1-2 months. Once arrived I will upload the implanting and healing procceses etc. Will then also fill out the Project posts as well.
